cyclone.name: ELSA
cyclone.current_location: about 100 miles SSW of Tampa, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to continue north along the eastern Gulf of Mexico tonight, make landfall on the north-Florida Gulf Coast Wednesday morning, then accelerate northeast across Georgia and the Carolinas and off the Mid-Atlantic coast by late week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: north Florida Gulf Coast near the Steinhatchee River area

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch from north of Altamaha Sound, GA to South Santee River, SC
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning west coast of FL from Flamingo to south of Egmont Key and north of Steinhatchee River to Ochlockonee River; Hurricane Warning Egmont Key to Steinhatchee River; Storm Surge Warning Bonita Beach to Aucilla River including Tampa Bay
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida west coast and Big Bend, coastal Georgia, South Carolina Low-country, then Mid-Atlantic and New England coasts later in the period
weather_observation.wind: Occasional squalls with gusts 25–35 mph possible Tuesday night into early Wednesday
weather_observation.storm_surge: None for the southeast Florida Atlantic coast
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches with isolated spots up to 6 inches through Wednesday could cause brief urban flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes possible in outer rain bands
